main event: A civilian observed a white blinking light in Tupper Lake, New York on July 10, 1967, for approximately 30 minutes.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by Herman Meier, who was returning home from a party at around 10 o'clock at night,The object was described as making no noise and looking almost solid,Meier estimated the object to be 35 to 40 feet in diameter with little lights around the outside and a little light inside,The object moved behind clouds during the observation,The conclusion of the investigation suggested it was likely an aircraft based on the description.
sighted object: a white blinking light in the sky
witness description: Herman Meier, resident of Loudonville, N.Y.
